instruction: Please explain how the inclusion of China A shares in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index has affected the gap between emerging markets and developed markets in terms of index constituents.
output: The inclusion of China A shares in the MSCI Emerging Markets Index has resulted in a narrower gap between emerging markets and developed markets in terms of the number of standard index constituents, as indicated in the exhibit provided. This was a significant milestone event, as the number of index constituents in the MSCI China Index surpassed that in the MSCI USA Index for the first time since the November 2019 index rebalance. This suggests that the increasing presence of China A shares on global investment platforms has bolstered China’s position as an important player in the global investment landscape.
